item.title: 14 selling drugs | 13th May 2025
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On May 13th, 2025, at approximately 05:01,Â the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed violating his conditional order by...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On May 13th, 2025, at approximately 05:01,Â the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed violating his conditional order by pacing outside Flat 15â€™s door, a behavior noted to occur daily. During this time, a suspected drug transaction took place in plain view of the front door camera. An individual on a pushbike approached, exchanged money for a small packet containing a white substance with the resident, who then returned inside. Previous observations and reports indicate ongoing drug-related activity at Flat 14, including suspicious visitors, disturbances, and direct witnessing of similar transactions.

Reported To:
WDH (now vico homes) | The Police | Logged on this CMS

Details:
On May 13th, 2025, at approximately 05:01, the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed exiting his flat, immediately walking and loitering in front of Flat Number 15.
This is in violation of his conditional order yet is quickly becoming a more frequent daily occurrence.
The resident was seen pacing for approximately three minutes outside Flat 15.
During this time, a suspected drug transaction was captured on the front door camera.
An individual wearing either a balaclava or a black cap and hoodie arrived on a pushbike.
The resident of Flat 14 retrieved a small packet containing a white substance from his pocket and held it while the individual on the bicycle produced money.
The two then exchanged items: the resident handed over the packet and accepted the cash before returning inside.

Additional Context:
* There have been ongoing concerns regarding suspected drug activity at Flat 14 for years now.
* The resident has been overheard, through the bathroom ceiling, speaking on the phone about selling cocaine and storing proceeds in a digital account called “nest”.
* Individuals with suspicious behavior have previously approached us, inquiring about the resident of number 14 and expressing a need to “get some stuff.”
* There have been multiple incidents of disturbances, including a anorexic woman in distress shouting and banging at Flat 14â€™s door, reportedly due to an inability to purchase substances.
* Both us and other neighbors have witnessed suspected drug transactions at Flat 14â€™s door on several occasions.

Video:
The first three minutes of the residentâ€™s pacing have been condensed in the attached video for brevity.
The footage then slows to normal speed to clearly show the arrival of the individual on the pushbike and the subsequent exchange.
This incident is consistent with an ongoing pattern of suspected drug-related activity and repeated breaches of the residentâ€™s conditional order.

item.title: Suspicious Activity | 9th May 2025
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On May 9th, 2025, their were two separate logs, one in the morning with a friend of the resident...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On May 9th, 2025, their were two separate logs, one in the morning with a friend of the resident of number 14 looking at our door, and another in the evening with the resident of number 14 and the same person from the morning displaying suspicious behavior around our property and bin area, followed by the other personâ€™s departure.
* At 11:30 A friend of the resident of flat Number 14 was seen walking slowly near the front area of the flat and looking at our door.
– approached Number 14â€™s door, captured briefly on the side camera, left while checking his phone.
* At 22:25 The resident of flat Number 14 returned home with another individual.
– other person could be someone whom the resident sold a bicycle months ago, who works for the council, or it could be the person who was involved in a prior door-related incident.
– Both individuals walked past our property. pointing towards our bins and talking.
* At 22:26: Number 14 was seen walking slowly to the corner, then returning towards his own door while repeatedly glancing at our door and bin area.
– This behavior was similar to actions he took before receiving a police caution.
* At 22:27: The other person walked past our door and left the area, He was not seen again that evening.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS

Details:
On May 9th, 2025, at approximately 22:25, the resident of flat Number 14 was observed returning home accompanied by another individual.
This individual appeared to be someone previously seen with the resident earlier that morning.
We believe this person may be the same individual to whom the resident sold a bicycle a few months ago, who is known to work for the council, or possibly the person involved in a prior incident where an associate of the resident attempted to open our door while the resident observed from a distance.
Both individuals walked past our property, with the resident of Number 14 pointing/gesturing towards our bins and appearing to talk with the other person.
After passing, the resident returned alone.
At 22:26, he was seen walking slowly to the corner before returning towards his own door, repeatedly glancing at our door and bin area.
This behavior is consistent with actions he exhibited prior to receiving a police caution.
At 22:27, the other individual was observed walking past our door and leaving the premises. He was not seen again that evening.

Earlier that day (approximately 11 hours earlier), a friend of the resident of Number 14 was observed slowly walking near the front area of the flat and examining our door. He approached Number 14â€™s door and was also captured on the side camera before departing, appearing to check his phone as he left.
Although the side camera only recorded a few seconds, the footage has been included towards the end of the attached video for reference.

Video:

item.title: Suspicious Behavior | 10th April 2025
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On April 10th, 2025, at approximately 02:00, * Loud banging noises heard from Flat Number 14 starting around 2:00...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On April 10th, 2025, at approximately 02:00,
* Loud banging noises heard from Flat Number 14 starting around 2:00 AM, lasting intermittently until approximately 4:00 AM.
* Initial disturbance lasted 10 to 15 minutes before temporarily stopping, then resumed shortly before 3:00 AM.
* At approximately 2:59 AM, the resident exited his flat and walked past your front door to the edge of the grass near the bins, moving just out of camera view.
* He returned slowly and repeated this action at 3:01 AM, although his return was not fully captured on camera.
* At 3:01 AM, the resident was seen walking along the side of your flat (via living room camera), appearing to spit on or blow kisses at the window while looking directly at the CCTV.
* He walked past your flat slowly again, then moved toward the road near the bins, out of camera view.
* The resident was later seen returning to his flat, where loud banging noises resumed for an additional 10 to 20 minutes.
* Camera footage of these events covers the period between 2:59 AM and 3:03 AM.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS

Details:
On April 10th, 2025, at approximately 02:00, loud banging noises were heard coming from Flat Number 14.
This disturbance continued for approximately 10 to 15 minutes before temporarily ceasing. The banging resumed shortly before 03:00.

At approximately 02:59, the resident of Flat Number 14 was observed exiting his flat and walking past our front door to the edge of the grass near our bins, moving just out of the cameraâ€™s view. He then returned slowly, repeating this action at 03:01; however, on this occasion, his return was not captured on camera.
At 03:01, the resident was observed walking along the side of our flat, as recorded by our living room camera.
During this time, he appeared to either spit on our window or blow kisses towards the camera while looking directly at the CCTV.
He then walked past our flat again at a slow pace before returning to the front of our property. He proceeded to walk past our door and towards the end of the bins, this time moving in the direction of the road and out of camera view.
He was subsequently seen returning to his flat, where the loud banging noises resumed for a further 10 to 20 minutes.
Camera footage of these events was recorded between 02:59 and 03:03.
The noise disturbances were intermittent but continued from approximately 02:00 until around 04:00.

Video:

item.title: taking pictures, stalking | 6th November 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On November 6th, 2024, between 01:35PM and 01:00AM the next day, multiple suspicious activities involving the resident of no#14...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:

On November 6th, 2024, between 01:35PM and 01:00AM the next day, multiple suspicious activities involving the resident of no#14 were observed:
* At 01:35: no#14 appeared to be recording/photographing us as we left for shopping.
* Shortly after: no#14 was outside, walking towards our bins, then our front door.
* At 14:00: no#14 walked past tour window, observing it and the camera.
* At 20:00: Similar behaviour was noted, with only snapshots captured.
* At 01:00 (Nov 7th): no#14 walked his dog in front of our door, but no footage was recorded due to low light.

The incident has been reported to the police via 101 as advised by WDH Sam Palmer.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDHÂ  | The Police via 101

Details:
On November 6th, 2024, at approximately 01:35, we left to go shopping, we noticed the resident of no#14 standing at his window.
The individual appeared to be holding a phone in a manner suggesting he was recording or photographing us. Upon noticing that he had been seen, the resident of no#14 quickly ducked out of view.
Approximately two minutes after we had left, the resident of #14 was observed walking outside our flat.
He briefly returned before re-emerging, at which point he walked towards our bins aswell as fixating on our front door.
Further observations were made throughout the day:
*At 14:00, the resident of #14 was seen walking past the front room window of our flat, looking at both the windows and our camera.
*A similar observation was made at 20:00 as the resident was leaving his property. Only snapshots of this event were captured by the camera.
*At approximately 01:00 on the 7th, the resident of no#14 returned and took his dog out in front of our door camera. Due to low light conditions, the motion detector did not activate, and no footage was recorded.
*Action Taken:
As advised by WDH Sam Palmer, this incident has been reported to the police for further investigation and documentation.

Video:

item.title: Taking pictures, Trying to see inside flat, spitting on chairs, cig in pet water | 21st September 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: —1. On September 21, 2024, at approximately 11:18 AM, Nathaniel Beach was seen ——walking around the property with a...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
—1. On September 21, 2024, at approximately 11:18 AM, Nathaniel Beach was seen
——walking around the property with a mobile device, potentially recording or
——viewing the interior of the reporter’s flat.
—2. He was observed at the reporter’s front door, seemingly recording the entryway.
—3. Later in the evening, he engaged in more concerning behavior:
——â—‰ Standing at the front door and checking for witnesses
——â—‰ Spitting on chairs near the property
——â—‰ Pacing outside and looking at the camera
——â—‰ Deliberately placing a cigarette end in an outdoor pet water bowl
—1. His actions appeared calculated, including retreating backwards while
——maintaining eye contact with the door, as if waiting for a reaction.
—2. Incidents from 6:30 PM onwards were reported to the police via their online chat
——system due to high call volumes.
—3. A police appointment is scheduled for Sunday at 10 PM, and the matter will be
——further reported to WDH on Monday.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDHÂ  | The Police via 101

Details:
On Saturday, September 21, 2024, at approximately 11:18 AM, the resident of flat number 14, Mr. Nathaniel Beach, was observed via surveillance cameras once again engaging in suspicious behavior around our property.
The individual was seen holding a mobile device while walking around outside our flat.
He briefly moved out of camera range for approximately 30 seconds before returning to his flat.
11:32 AM: Our living room camera captured him outside our property, holding his phone in a manner suggesting he was recording or attempting to view the interior of our bedroom and living room windows.
11:33 AM: he was observed at our front door (One minute later).
His actions, including moving his phone up and down while looking around, indicated he was more than likley recording our entryway.
He then returned to his flat.
6:30 PM: he was observed standing at our front door, staring, then moving towards the bin area before returning. His behavior suggested he was checking for witnesses.
7:05 PM: he left his residence, heading towards the park up the hill.
7:30 PM: Upon returning, he crossed the grass towards our bins, paused, then approached the chairs, spat on them, and proceeded to his flat.
10:21 PM: he was then seen pacing outside.
10:22 PM: He walked past the window, looking at the camera while smoking.
10:24 PM: he then passed by again, moving towards the front of the property.
10:25 PM: he approached our front door and stood staring for several seconds. He attempted to discard his cigarette in our outdoor pet water bowl, initially missing. He then bent down, retrieved the cigarette end, and deliberately placed it in the water.
He retreated backwards, maintaining his gaze on the door, seemingly waiting for a reaction. After pausing at a distance, he moved towards our bins before returning to his flat.
All incidents from 6:30 PM onwards have been reported to the police via their online chat system, as advised due to high call volumes. The report has been forwarded to PC O’Neil.
This matter will be further reported to WDH on Monday, following the scheduled police appointment on Sunday at 10 PM.

Video:

item.title: Taking chairs to throw into street, Spitting on door & throwing tab end in animal water bowl | 14th September 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On September 14, 2024, at approximately 07:15, the resident of 14 Pine Close once again engaged in a series...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On September 14, 2024, at approximately 07:15, the resident of 14 Pine Close once again engaged in a series of disruptive and concerning behaviors:

  1. Early morning disturbance: Shouting at 4 AM, presumably on the phone.
    likely unable to order his cocaine for the day, (usually the reason for his shouting)
  2. Suspicious activity, property damage and theft (around 7:15 AM):
    • Paced around front of our door while smoking
    • Discarded cigarette in pet water bowl
    • Repeatedly entered and exited his flat, surveying the area
    • Brought out his dog briefly
    • Spat on our door again
    • Took our chairs and walked towards the road
    • Quickly returned to his flat, passing a man walking a dog

This event are part of ongoing issues with this neighbor, indicating a pattern of problematic behavior.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDHÂ  | The Police via 101

Details:
On September 14, 2024, at approximately 07:15 the resident of 14 Pine Close exhibited disruptive behavior yet again, including prolonged periods of walking around and shouting, presumably on the phone, at 4 AM. The situation escalated when the individual spat on our door, disposed of a half smoked cig in our pet water bowl turning it yellow, and removed our chairs, leaving them down the road. This incident has been reported to the police via 101, PC Daniel O’Neil via email, and Sam Palmer, our council representative, through One Call, who has been updated on the ongoing issues.

At approximately 7:15 AM, the neighbor emerged from his residence, smoking a cigarette while pacing in front of our door area. After two minutes of this behavior, he positioned himself near our outdoor chairs, which we use as a bird table due to a previous incident where he attempted to break in by smashing them against our door. He partially finished his cigarette and discarded it into the pet water bowl turning it yellow before returning to his flat.

Fifteen minutes later, the individual reappeared, briefly surveying the area before retreating to retrieve his dog. He then stood on the grass with the dog while continuing to look around, only to return the dog to his flat after a short period. Two minutes later, he reemerged, fixating on our door and chairs, he spat at our front door again, and walked past. He was then observed moving slowly across the area, seemingly checking for witnesses. He approached our chairs, stared at them, looked around once more, and proceeded to take them, walking towards the road. Finally, he hurriedly returned to his flat, walking past a man from over the road with his dog, Sid, in the process. (seen in at end of the longer uncut video).

Video (cut version): 3 Minutes, 50 Seconds long, coped main parts

Video (uncut version): 22 Minutes, 32 Seconds long

item.title: Smashing animal water tub #2 | 16th August 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On August 16, 2024, at approximately 13:18: The occupant of flat 14 returned from a local shop. He stared...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On August 16, 2024, at approximately 13:18:

  1. The occupant of flat 14 returned from a local shop.
  2. He stared at our flat’s entryway while passing.
  3. He then returned and focused on our door for about 10 seconds.
  4. The individual forcefully kicked and smashed a water dish we had placed for local animals (2nd time today).
  5. Finally, he returned to his flat, making excessive noise.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDHÂ  | The Police via 101

Details:
On August 16, 2024 at approximately 13:18the the occupant of flat 14 was observed returning from a local shop. Upon approach, the he directed his gaze towards our flat’s entryway while passing. Subsequently, the person returned to the vicinity of our doorway, maintaining visual focus on our door for an estimated duration of 10 seconds. Following this, the individual proceeded to forcefully smash a recently placed water receptacle by kicking it, which had been positioned for the purpose of providing hydration to local animals. The person then returned to their flat, producing an excessive and disruptive level of noise.

Video:

Photos:

item.title: Throwing things at door, Smashing animal water tub | 16th August 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On August 16, 2024, at 09:58 AM: The tenant of flat 14 was seen walking his dog near the...
item.content:encoded:
Summery: On August 16, 2024, at 09:58 AM:

  1. The tenant of flat 14 was seen walking his dog near the residence, frequently looking at the entrance.
  2. After briefly returning to his door, he threw a metallic object at our door, disturbing our cats to awakening us.
  3. About 20 seconds later, he approached our front door, mumbling to himself.
  4. He then deliberately damaged a water container for neighborhood pets before returning to his flat.

The previous night:

  1. Loud noises and excessive shouting were heard from upstairs.
  2. The tenant was overheard having a long, loud phone conversation.
  3. The call appeared to be an attempt to obtain illegal substances, which seems to be a daily occurrence.
  4. His attempt was unsuccessful, possibly due to depleted supply from his mass previous purchases.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS | WDHÂ  | The Police via 101

Details:
On August 16, 2024 at approximately 09:58AM, security camera footage captured the following incident involving the tenant of flat 14: The individual was observed walking his dog in the vicinity of our residence, frequently glancing towards our entrance. After briefly returning to his unit, the tenant reappeared, and his shadow was visible on the ground. At this point, the footage shows him retrieving a metallic object and propelling it at our door, causing distress to our cats (which woke us up). Subsequently, the tenant returned his dog to his flat. Approximately 20 seconds later, he approached our front door directly, appearing to speak to himself. Upon reaching our doorstep, he directed his attention to a water receptacle we maintain for the benefit of neighborhood pets. The tenant then deliberately damaged this container, fracturing it into two pieces, before retreating to his own residence.

The previous night audible disturbances emanated from upstairs. The tenant was overheard engaging in a loud, prolonged telephone conversation. Based on the content of this call, it appeared that the individual was attempting to procure illicit substances, an activity that has been observed to occur on a daily basis. On this particular occasion, the tenant’s efforts seemed to be unsuccessful, potentially due to excessive prior purchases depleting the available supply from his regular source.

Video:

Photos:

item.title: sticking finger up at camera whilst walking past | 15th June 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On the 15th of June, 2024, the individual residing in flat number 14 was observed via our security footage...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On the 15th of June, 2024, the individual residing in flat number 14 was observed via our security footage making an offensive gesture with his middle finger directed at the camera while passing by our window. Additionally, towards the conclusion of the video clip, he is seen making a similar gesture towards the bedroom window, where a non-functional camera is installed.

Reported To:
Logged on this CMS for Joe at WDH to see

Impact:
Annoying

Details:
At approximately 4:48 PM, the resident of number 14 proceeded to take his dog outside for its 20 second a day walk to the adjacent grassy area. Subsequent to re-entering his flat with the dog, he then navigated towards the side of the flat’s. Upon passing by the window, he abruptly turned back and gestured inappropriately towards the surveillance cameras. Attached is a video recording captured by our living room security camera. It should be noted that another camera, located in our bedroom, was also subjected to the offensive gesture; although currently non-operational, its presence is discernible in the latter part of the attached video.

Video: basic Microsoft webcam in living room window

Photos:

item.title: Outside light punched, pacing In dark pretending to be on phone to take photos | 8th June 2024
item.dc:creator: no#15
item.description: Summery: On June 8, 2024, disturbances began around 1:30 AM with noises akin to hammering. The individual from flat number...
item.content:encoded:
Summery:
On June 8, 2024, disturbances began around 1:30 AM with noises akin to hammering. The individual from flat number 14 was suspected of searching for surveillance cameras, as evidenced by his behavior with his dog and previous incidents involving his associates. Despite considering contacting WDHâ€™s out-of-hours service, the intermittent cessation of noise led us to refrain. Later, the tenant exhibited suspicious behavior outside, including feigned phone conversations and observable flashes from his phone camera, suggesting covert recording activities. At 3:20 AM, he approached the door, likely recording, and at 3:42 AM, he struck an exterior light fixture. These actions are consistent with past observations of drug-related transactions and usage, specifically cocaine, as well as withdrawal symptoms during periods without narcotics.
Reported To:
WDH and the police

Impact:
Caused stress that negatively affects Lucy’s heart condition’s.

Key Points:
Stressed, Annoying, logged as “endangerment”,

Details:
On the 8th of June, 2024, at approximately 1:30 AM, we were disturbed by loud noises resembling hammering, which interrupted our sleep and prompted us to consider contacting the out-of-hours service provided by WDH. However, the noise ceased intermittently, leading us to believe it would stop like normal, rendering a service call potentially unnecessary. Subsequently, just before 2:00 AM, we observed the individual from flat number 14 descending the stairs with considerable force, ostensibly to walk his dog. We have reasons to suspect that his true intention was to search for surveillance equipment, a behavior we have witnessed on multiple occasions. This suspicion is supported by the fact that he was observed pacing back and forth and interrupting the dogâ€™s natural behavior, as captured in the accompanying video at the 44-second mark.

Our previous incident report includes footage of an associate of the tenant from flat number 14 attempting to open our door while the tenant himself stood by his own door, presumably to ascertain the presence of a camera monitoring that area.

Thirty minutes later, at 2:31 AM, the tenant returned outdoors without his dog and loitered for several minutes. This activity is highlighted in the video with a motion-tracing arrow. During this time, he appeared to engage in a phone conversation, but the intermittent flashes from his phone camera, particularly when he moved through shadowed areas, suggest otherwise. These flashes are evident in the video at 1:30 and again at 2:24.

At 3:20 into the video, the tenant approaches the door, continuing the pretense of a phone conversation, likely with the intent of recording video footage. We believe this was done to scrutinize the area for cameras with greater detail at a later time. Shortly thereafter, he is seen striking the exterior light fixture, an act clearly visible in the video at 3:42.

This incident appears to be another instance of erratic behavior, which we have observed to correlate with periods when the tenant lacks narcotics. Such behavior includes restlessness and involuntary movements, symptomatic of withdrawal from potent drugs.

While we cannot definitively identify the substance involved, there is a strong likelihood that it is cocaine, based on repeated observations of the tenant engaging in transactions involving white powders at his doorstep. This has been corroborated by several neighbors and is further evidenced by frequent visits to vehicles and motorcycles, as well as audible indications of drug use, including chopping sounds, snorting, and exclamations, occurring sporadically throughout the day and night.

Video: (New camera setup, a21 phone camera in door peep hole)
Â Â Â Â  â“˜ This video utilizes media codecs that are incompatible with Firefox and requires a browser based on Chrome to play.

â“˜ The video lacks audio as it is streamed via YouTube directly to a private profile. This approach not only leverages YouTubeâ€™s unlimited storage capacity but also ensures access to the footage in the event the recording device is compromised. Nonetheless, due to YouTubeâ€™s copyright policies, the audio was removed after detecting copyrighted content from a television program in the background.
Click here to enlarge.

 

Photos: (small selection of screenshots taken from video)
